WRITING.TEXT: My dad would always talk about David's physique. He would say, "they should just have a picture of David Robinson in those textbooks about how to draw the human body and muscles. Every muscle in his body is defined." I miss talking to my dad about David Robinson's physique.
EXTRIMISTS. We boot anyone who doesn't play their quarters. Tier 7 on BO Outlaw.

Sure, there's a bit of an assumption going on, but I don't think it is an egregious assumption. He's clearly dismissed underhanded free throws in the past and we have many big men on record stating that they wouldn't do it because it's embarrassing. Since Drummond hasn't said much about it other than his refusal to shoot that way, people are assuming it is for the most obvious reason; the reason Wilt and Shaq didn't want to do it.
"I felt silly, like a sissy, shooting underhanded," Chamberlain wrote in his autobiography. "I know I was wrong. I just couldn't do it."

Can you show me the source that says they tried it and didn't notice an improvement?
The narrative comes from dozens of articles stating his hesitancy to shoot underhand.
Like this one: http://www.courant.com/sports/uconn-mens-basketball/hc-calhoun-charity-game-feature-0814-20160813-story.html
Drummond continues to work on free throws, along with his footwork, though he dismisses any suggestion he should try shooting them underhand. "I'm just really just continuing to work on back-to-the-basket stuff," he said, "and working on getting better from the foul line. I'm going to stick with the formula I have now."
You can't talk about pictures of GSP looking solid and tight with great angles and not produce them.

Luke Walton in 15 years would probably tear him up.
Edit: Bill Walton would probably win and he doesn't even have knees.
indubitably
Yeah, it should be in the article.
Underrated comment. I still don't know pain like I experienced in .04 seconds, though. I remember everything about the final moments of that game.

Here is what a few people are referencing:
"I think Golden State and some other teams play very well, but look at the game of basketball. They run one play. Well, maybe two plays. They've got a high-pick with the center, then the shooters run baseline trying to get open with blocks from the forwards. I mean that's it. You don't see hardly any reverse plays at all, no double screens, no weak side and whatnot."
http://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/oscar-robertson-has-some-interesting-takes-on-warriors-state-of-nba/
Yo, I'm dead man if we don't start Dedmon!
Isn't that what we call Shawn Marion's jump shot?
Because what you posted belongs in the general discussion. Also, the title was atrocious...it should have been removed on those grounds alone. This post is also going to get removed.

Probably came from places like this: http://www.cbssports.com/nba/news/andre-drummond-still-dismissing-the-idea-of-shooting-free-throws-underhand/
Or this: http://www.mlive.com/pistons/index.ssf/2016/08/report_pistons_andre_drummond_1.html
or this: https://twitter.com/AndreDrummond/status/368833109904482304?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw
There's been a number of articles on his hesitancy to shoot underhand. There's also been articles stating that everything is on the table, but he clearly still seems hesitant to shoot underhand. As a fan, r/snoaH_ could be right that they tried it and it didn't work, but it doesn't mean that he hasn't been hesitant to try it.

WRITING.TEXT: Y'all got to cut this out (/s). These posts basically caused me to lose my relationship with time.
block the wind while I roast this bone for Klay.
Trump supporter confirmed: see grammar.

The guy is still holding campaign rallys so he can see how many people like him. He's a guy who wanted desperately to have the biggest inauguration crowd. No...he doesn't care what people think about him.
I've got two boxes, one for playoff eating and one for saving. My friend from Texas is so nice! I only asked for one.
Yeah, but if you criticize someone's grammar, regardless of the setting, you're kind of asking with it when you post "I dunno" in sentence with a comma splice.
Because, it's the internet, an extra fancy version of Being John Malkovich, where we are all inside peoples heads and picking up on their motivations.

MCW came in right when I was at a low point in my NBA fandom. This year I've paid far more attention to the league and was surprised to find out that he was a non entity. He was getting hyped as one of the best players in the league. Did something specifically happen to him?

If DFish can grab the ball and turn around and then shoot the ball in .04 seconds, a person can pass the ball when he draws extra defenders with more than 3 seconds on the clock... but if you replace person with Melo, yeah he's going to shoot it every time. You could have sent the whole arena after him and he's going to shoot it...at this point, how can you argue when he's the best player on that team and he makes the shot.

and I really don't even get why they are annoyed by it. Parents are aloud to want things for their kids. He even came out and clarified that his son will play for another team, that he was simply trying to speak his desires into reality, which a lot of people do without receiving any criticisms. No reason for us to go old testament and start judging someone based on what their parent says and desires.

Too be fair, this is a super click-baity title. It doesn't take into account other quotes from him that clarify what he meant:
I'm not trying to say he won't play for a different team. But I'd like him to play for the Lakers because it's home and I'd love him to learn from Magic [Johnson]. He's the best guard ever to me, and nobody better for Lonzo to learn from than Magic Johnson.
All I said was that my boy is going to play for the Lakers, and I'm going to speak it into existence. I want him to be a Laker, but I wasn't saying he's only going to play for the Lakers.
Except fans don't like to watch people play basketball who are not supremely talented or good at basketball...so it's a bit of a stretch to say that's the only reason.

Bro, with this comment.
"I watched the movie Concussion" AMA
Which is an asshole comment. It's not like I was trying to oversell what I know, or act like I was an authority on the issue, but I did spend half a year of my life researching a paper and working on my presentation on head injuries in sports last year, so I alluded to that.
then you right after:
CT scan shows a mild concussion but cant show concussions. How does that work? I am not a doctor or a CT guy
The sarcasm is oozing out of your statement, because I'm a doctor or a CT guy... C'mon, get some self awareness. I made it clear that I wasn't an authority on the issue, so it's pretty clear where your comment is coming from by saying that. I take offense to people being dicks to people who were never mean or malicious to them or anyone else. I just think its an asshole move and far too many people feel like it's necessary to put people in there place, so yeah, I'll be an asshole to anyone who goes after me in someway unprovoked, every time.
Yeah, because that's what I'm really responding to...funny you had to go and prove my point.

A lot of smart asses on the sub today. My disagreement is whether you can say he had a mild concussion from that play. I was citing what the report was, that he he had a mild concussion and it was diagnosed by a CT scan, hence "apparently." I then disagreed that a CT can definitively diagnose a concussion. Learn to read, and next time add something to the discussion.
You don't have to sell me of Manu. I just think there is an argument for Rodman; it's not absurd.

As a Spurs fan (and yes I know Rodman was a Spur), I agree. Rodman is arguably the greatest rebounder of all time, and I'd definitely pick him as number one out of the last 30 years. I don't think Manu is in the top five in any catagory, so by virtue of that, it's a debate.
For those who don't know: this fight has been in the making far longer than McGregor vs. Mayweather. Are we going on almost five years now?
then we eat a bowl of Slam Duncan O's in front of it.
That video should be our Peyton.
It'd be more exciting if it was Buddy "the Curry" Hield taking that three.

Just an opinion. I only saw the report come out from Adrian Wojnarowski. As far as I know, Kobe and the Lakers never came out and verified that he had a concussion. I am not an expert on concussions; however, I did do extensive research on them and presented my findings at my college's symposium. They are incredibly tricky/impossible to diagnose, so I am just a bit skeptical that he had a concussion based on the video and the CT scan, but he certainly could have.

I doubt he had a concussion. He had a CT scan that apparently showed a very mild concussion, but it's not like CT scans can really detect a concussion to begin with. I never saw a report that he was experiencing concussion like symptoms, and he did not exhibit them on the court during that game. I also don't see much in the hit and the movement of his head to suggest a concussion. If he did indeed get one, it was a freak occurrence.
When I think midrange, I think Rip Hamilton. I miss me some Rip midrange.
I think about game 5 youthful Horry all the time. One of my favorite NBA moments.
I laughed out loud when I saw the sister act one!

You nailed it. I personally love it. Right or wrong, he's simply poking fun of two of the sports biggest heels (and they willingly made themselves into the heels) via memes that people are sending him. There is a lot of stuff in the world to be mad about...this just doesn't seem that high on the list. Could it be crossing the line? Maybe, but that's the nature of trying to get those kind of laughs. If you laugh at 9/11 meme or the like, and this is where you draw the line: see priorities.

No chance. He was only taking 7 shots a game last season, shooting nearly 50%. He could average 10 points a game if you gave him the shots. He wasn't trash offensively, he was filling the role pop wanted him to (kind of like Tony is doing now).

Attach a head shot of Curry and say it's you to increase chances.
You're doing god's work, thank you.
Prettty.....prettyy...short.
Spsh, naw, give me Adam Morrison.

Dude, you can't read can you. I've stated multiple times that I am not accusing him, and never once did I accuse him. I'll offer you the same challenge: produce the line where I say Travis committed domestic assault. I said that I believe the most appropriate response is impartiality, since we don't know one way or another. I think it's fair to take allegations seriously, and not to assume they're false because we don't readily have evidence to prove their validity. If I knew more about this case, and had more details than I think any of us currently have, perhaps I would firmly rest my opinion on one side or the other. I did imply that I refuse to call her a liar without evidence. Out of the two of us, you're the only one making judgement calls without evidence.
It's a very valid point because we live in a lawful society, you can say it's not a valid but that's called insanity.
I'm sorry, I just don't base my morals on the legal system. Do you believe OJ committed double homicide? What about Robert Blake? Lot's of guilty people roaming around who were never proven guilty...like that guy riding around on my bike somewhere.
Here's a lesson: people aren't insane just because they disagree with you. (again, your position: he's innocent, mine: impartiality...in case you forgot again)

LMA really doesn't want to be relied on too much. I've never seen a player so talented who didn't want to be the best player on the team. The way he talks, it's almost as if he'd prefer being less talented and more of a role player. I am sure he's excited Pau is back. I love LMA a lot more lately, and I will be vocally supporting him more than I have been, but it doesn't there's not a little voice in my head that is unsure if LMA loves basketball.

You're the one all over the place. I am being consistent. Go back and read everything I said.
You can't say this:
I don't believe in anything in relation to this because it hasn't been tried and she hasn't pressed charges.
and then be entirely partisan. "I don't believe in anything in relation to this, except that he's innocent." I said you're aloud to have an opinion (again, please read above), but I made it clear that yours was no better than holding a contrary opinion. You can keep citing the criteria for the US legal system over and over, but it's not going to make it a valid point.
Edit:
I'm not going to assume he beat his wife without proof.
But you will assume he didn't without proof. I'd just as soon not assume, because you know what they say about it.

but the fact is no one knows about the situation and I'm not going to just assume guilt because he was accused over instagram.
But you are going assume his innocence.
the burden of producing evidence is on the accuser.
Again, in the court of law. If two people make claims and we don't have any evidence in favor of either of them, and we also don't know them personally, the correct answer is to be impartial. You somehow think the correct answer is to assume the "victim" is lying, and I think that's dangerous and a terrible policy. You also don't know if there is no evidence because all you saw was some pictures on instagram. The case never got tried, you've barely heard from the "victim." We've heard a lot more from the person being accused.
Yeah no crap I'm going to believe the person being accused if there is no evidence, the burden of producing evidence is on the accuser.
This is your policy, and it's your right to believe this. All I am saying is that it doesn't get us any closer to the real truth. It is as likely to be right as holding the opposite opinion. Acting like your opinion in a he said, she said debate is the undeniable truth and people are wrong for holding a contrary opinion is incredibly silly.
If you point out the line where I said I think Travis did it, I'll admit that you have a point, mate.

You guys have to really learn how to read. Where did I say Travis was guilty?
That's quite frankly bullshit, you're just believing the accuser without any legitimate evidence.
That's quite frankly bullshit, you're just believing the person being accused without any legitimate evidence
Ask yourself why she would post pictures on instagram instead of actually going to the police?
I'm not in the business of getting inside people's heads and figuring out their motivations. Domestic assault goes unreported all the time (I know that for a fact). I can tell you why I think those people, whom I am close to, did not report it, but I won't speculate on the motivation of someone I don't know. I also won't even claim that I know the assault did or did not happen in this case.
Man, you love to see it happen. Good job Buzznights. If you forget about that time you were racist, that probably means your racist all the time.

It's "he said, she said".
he likely never did
Dude, you are taking a side in the he said she said argument. I don't get how people don't get this. Bringing in the requirement for the US judicial system is not evidence for your opinion. Innocent until proven guilty is not a monolithic barometer for the truth. People never get charged, yet they are guilty. Murders go unsolved.
Again, if you think he did it: it's an opinion (since you weren't there and we don't have the evidence).
If you think he's innocent: again, it's an opinion (since we weren't there and we don't have the evidence).
Speaking of which, mine is '05.
[never forget](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rVVaMEHmvAE)
Then you'll love the original interviews.

I just said your point was weak, because it is. Your new argument is, because I wasn't there it didn't happen. I also find it strange how someone who immediately doesn't read what people say (if you doubt me, its above) and responds on gut instinct is getting up-voted. Where is my pitchfork at? Point out the line where I pulled out a pitchfork. I just disagreed with the people who thought you had a good point. In fact, I never even said I thought Travis was guilty! I've remained neutral. What I did was argue that your opinion, that he wasn't found guilty in the court of law so we should assume his innocence, seemed off. It says nothing about whether he put his hands on his wife in a violent way. It also says nothing about his innocence. Innocent until proven guilty applies to when you have been formally charged with a crime in the US court of law. If the US judicial system is the barometer for the truth for someone, I fear they are very misguided.
Yeah, he chucked a million shit darts at the wall and a few hit the bullseye.
People who post on this sub and get upvoted all the time?
or reality.

Are you one of those "because it's illegal it's morally wrong" kind of people. It's kind of a weak point: "this is why we have a judicial system." So if I see someone murders someone and they doesn't get convicted, I just say, "whelp, this is why we have the legal system. I guess they're innocent," or if someone gets raped and their rapist gets off, "I guess I didn't get raped then. I guess they're innocent." You know how many people commit crimes and never get charged? Does that mean they didn't do it? At the end of the day, you either believe the "victim" or the "suspect." At the end of the day, it's your opinion, since you weren't there. You choose to support Travis, which is your right, but it doesn't mean that it's right.
I think Lin is going to be better for you from three.

You're joking, right? Steve Kerr worked hard for what he's got. He's supremely talented, and he helped us win a championship.
In case you forgot: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkgjl7yBkJ8

They are not just bored...they legitimately love Kawhi and the Spurs. They feel like he was disrespected, and for some reason they have taken it to heart. Sometimes passion gets misdirected, that's all.

No, because all those guys on the Kings did all those things that no one heard about that were much worse, and the Kings did nothing! They can't get rid of their star player/leader of the team for doing things a bunch of people have heard about, and being a bully. /s

The fact that you had to ask his name shows why this whole issue isn't as black and white as people are making it, and people are clearly losing a bit of perspective. Now, if someone says, "the guy who currently plays, gets technical fouls all the time and regularly causes a scene," you'll say, "you mean the Kings star player Boogie?" They probably don't even need to mention the Kings. Severity of crime matters more when all things are equal. If a murder happens, you don't know about it, and you've never heard of the guy who committed it, I bet it matters a lot less to you than hearing someone you knew stole a candy bar. The common basketball watcher probably knows about Boogie's techs. You and I, who actively visit a basketball forum, didn't know who he was talking about...I think that's all you really need to know.
He came up huge against Dallas, hitting some key threes. I will always respect Kerr.

WRITING.TITLE: Allstar deal
WRITING.TEXT:
The story: I really need to close a few accounts and get caught up with school. I have a second account, and every account I created to try to supplement my main account for ASW ended up on the same auction house as my second account. I can't keep up with it, so everything has to go except for my main account. I'd like to get some of those coins to my main account, but I am willing to take a loss. If I find a fair partner, there is opportunity for more deals, for I will be selling off entire teams. I will offer the same deal as bellow (percentage wise). I think this is fair: 50K+ for minimal work. As far as vouching for myself, I've been active on here. I've put a lot of work into this game, so I would never cheat someone else out of their hard work. Hopefully someone gives me the same respect!
Here is the break down
I have 1,179,406 The AH takes 10% = 117,940 You will be handling the new total = 1,061,465 and you will receive 5% of this total = 53,073 The new total of 1,008,392 will be sent to AH3
He's got a lot of time on his hands since the Rams fired him.

I've placed a bid on something, went to checkk on it, and it was gone. I lost 150K. Glitches happen in AH. I contacted EA and got the run around. I'd count them gone. Don't even bother contacting EA if you want to save yourself frustration.
Nice pull! I've been waiting on a single storyline forever.
And then people get paid to go on tv to say that, as of right now, Melo is a better scorer and player than Kawhi...
I got Malik.
Good choice. Also, Bonner is unbelievably cut in person. I was very impressed by his body when I saw it. The paleness doesn't translate the muscles on tv.
No...they accounted for it. That is why he was free.
Erick Dampier, right?
He use to turn around and back into his opponent as they shot a jump shot. Sometimes they'd roll their ankles coming down. Sometimes he wears a bow tie.
I'm not doubting it. I'm sure he's well aware. It doesn't mean I still can't have a chuckle.

Yes. I love everything he said. I need to watch more interviews with him. I left watching that with a warm feeling (even if he had played bad this last game, I don't think that would change) about the guy. I have to admit, I don't know if I have given LMA the same fair shake that I've given other Spurs over the year.
I thought it was strange though for him to say: "There's a guy who can't control his temper." Things the Kings could say about their own super star for 1,000?
